data.title: The Journey of JBZL and the Birth of Ascension Entertainment by Las Vegas EDM Podcast
data.meta_description:
Welcome to the Las Vegas EDM Podcast. In this captivating episode, we have a special guest, the founder of Ascension Entertainment, Jordan Berry, known in the EDM realm as JBZL, formerly Tarxan. His transformation from hip-hop to EDM and his incredible story of resilience through addiction is nothing short of inspirational.
JBZL's name change marked a pivotal moment in his life, symbolizing a shift in his music style and a personal journey of triumph over Xanax addiction. Please tune in to hear his powerful story and the strength it took to make this transformative change.
The inception of Ascension Entertainment sprang from a disappointing desert rave experience in California. Dissatisfied with the event's quality, JBZL believed he could infuse his creativity and EDM expertise into hosting exceptional events for artists and the community. His vision materialized with the launch of their first desert festival in March 2023.
As a DJ and producer, JBZL's heart beats to the rhythms of dubstep and trap, but he considers himself a multi-faceted artist with diverse musical influences. He's performed at notable events for the Church Of Bass, Ravelation, and various events in Los Angeles, amassing a decade of experience behind the decks.
Born in Los Angeles, CA, and a resident of Las Vegas, NV, for 22 years, JBZL brings a unique blend of West Coast energy to his music and events. In this episode, you'll get to know the man behind the music and the visionary behind Asencion Entertainment.
But that's not all. Our guest host, Toyss, engages JBZL in a playful game, challenging him to decide who he'd "fuck, marry, and kill" among EDM's elite: Skrillex, Subtronics, and RL Grime. It's a lighthearted moment in an otherwise insightful conversation.
Recorded live at the iconic Jackpot Bar & Grill in Las Vegas, this episode encapsulates the essence of the EDM community and its vibrant personalities. Join us as we explore the EDM universe through JBZL's incredible journey and the electric atmosphere of the Las Vegas EDM scene. Welcome to the Las Vegas EDM Podcast, where the music never stops, and the stories are always extraordinary.
data.text:
In this episode of the Las Vegas EDM Podcast, we are thrilled to welcome our good friends Render94, also known as Jeremy Cruz, and NeoPunk, also known as Navid Nilchian. These two talented DJs and music producers have a unique and inspiring story of how they met and became part of the Las Vegas electronic music scene, a journey that will surely inspire you.

Navid moved to Las Vegas two years ago and, eager to connect with fellow music enthusiasts, decided to host open deck sessions at his house. This initiative helped him make new friends and brought together a community of like-minded individuals. It was at one of these open deck events that Navid and Jeremy first crossed paths, sparking a friendship and musical collaboration that continues to this day.

Jeremy, who performs under the moniker Render94, is known for his unique blend of melodic house and techno beats. His music, characterized by its rich, expressive melodies and intricate production, is sure to captivate you. Navid, performing as NeoPunk, brings a different flavor with his deep, driving techno sounds. Both have carved out their niches in the electronic music world, yet they share a common passion for pushing the boundaries of their genres.

In this episode, we delve into the stories behind their stage names. Jeremy explains how Render94 came about, sharing insights into his creative process and the influences that shaped his identity as an artist. On the other hand, Navid reveals the inspiration behind NeoPunk and how it reflects his rebellious spirit and dedication to the techno scene.

The conversation also covers the broader journey of becoming an electronic DJ and producer. Jeremy and Navid discuss the challenges they've faced, from mastering the technical aspects of music production to navigating the competitive landscape of the music industry. Their journey is a testament to the power of perseverance, creativity, and staying true to one's artistic vision. Their words will surely inspire you on your own creative journey.

One of the highlights of this episode is Navid's thrilling account of being hired to perform a six-hour set at a California State University party. He describes the electrifying atmosphere of the event, which attracted 3,000 attendees and took place in an underground structure. Navid's story captures the essence of live performance and the unique energy of connecting with a massive crowd through music, as he shares the challenges and triumphs of performing a six-hour set and the unique atmosphere of the underground structure.

Tune in to hear these captivating stories and gain deeper insights into the lives of Render94 and NeoPunk. Whether you're a seasoned fan of electronic music or just starting to explore the genre, this episode offers a fascinating glimpse into the world of two dedicated and passionate artists.

Welcome to another episode of the Las Vegas EDM Podcast! Today, we're excited to introduce a one-of-a-kind guest, Teddy Rotten. Known for his unconventional style and unique persona, Teddy has been in the electronic music scene for a while.

Formerly known as Monava, Teddy has been a prolific producer for over a decade, exploring a wide range of genres. From pop to drum and bass, dubstep to house, his versatility and unique style keep us all intrigued. Among his many creations, Future House stands out as a true testament to his musical prowess.

Managed by Alexandar Skerlich from Rage and Recover, Teddy is not just a producer but also a dynamic DJ. Catch him spinning tunes as a resident DJ at the renowned Vibe FM, where his energy and passion for music truly come alive. With his prolific output of 2-3 songs a day, Teddy's creativity knows no bounds.

Join us as we delve into Teddy Rotten's world, where music, personality, and passion collide. Stay tuned for an exciting conversation that's sure to inspire and entertain!

This episode was recorded at On Decks Talent Agency, LLC.

Hosted by Christopher Tapia

www.lasvegasedm.com

www.rageandrecover.com

Welcome back to the Las Vegas EDM Podcast! Join guests Mikey Made and Bumparoo straight from Off The Grid Campout in this episode. Mikey, the mastermind behind the campout, and Bumparoo, his executive assistant, share their journey from the dusty desert to the global EDM scene.

Tune in as Mikey reveals his event-hosting origins and the evolution of Off The Grid Campout since its inception in 2015. Learn how DJs and producers can join their mission and be a part of the next big thing in the EDM world.

As the founder of True Entertainment, Mikey Made has taken the collective to new heights, and now, he's gearing up for his latest venture: True Trip. With True Trip, the collective will be spreading their beats across the globe.

But it's not just Mikey in the spotlight! Bumparoo, with her infectious energy and talent, is making waves in the music scene. Check her out this summer at Sunburn, where she has a residency.

This episode is not only filled with hilarious banter and inside jokes. Join us as we delve into the world of Off The Grid Campout, Mikey Made, and Bumparoo. And don't miss out on the story behind Bumparoo's unforgettable stage name!

Recorded at On Decks Talent Agency

Hosted by Christopher Tapia & Victoria Suruy

Mikey Made www.truedancemusic.com

www.lasvegasedm.com

Welcome back to the Las Vegas EDM Podcast, where we dive deep into the world of electronic dance music and the incredible stories behind its artists. In this episode, we have the pleasure of hosting a rising star in the EDM scene, Nate Yergler, known to his fans as Von Yergen.

Nate's journey is nothing short of inspirational. Born in California with a rich German and Dutch heritage, his brother introduced him to the world of EDM at a young age, and he instantly fell in love with the music. Little did he know that this passion would lead him on a remarkable path.

Tune in as Nate shares how he began his DJing career in May/June of 2020 when the world was going through unprecedented challenges. Nate's resilience and unwavering dedication to his craft would soon put him in the right place at the right time.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, Nate played weekly on the beach, creating a unique experience for partygoers with silent disco sets. On these sandy shores, he crossed paths with Kenton McDougall, aka Flow Chucker, a fellow DJ and producer. This encounter would eventually lead Nate to perform at the prestigious Metatronica Festival.

But the story doesn't end there. Nate's journey took an unexpected turn when he met Thor Wixom, the leading steadicam operator for Insomniac, the powerhouse behind some of the world's most significant EDM events. Thor recognized Nate's talent and invited him to join the Insomniac team, forever changing the course of his career.

Nate's musical journey reached new heights when he released his debut track on JackEL's label, solidifying his position in the industry as a Tech House force to be reckoned with. Today, he continues to make waves with his regular Techno event every 2nd Thursday at the Air Conditioned Lounge in San Diego.

Join us as we delve into the incredible story of Nate Yergler, aka Von Yergen, and discover how his love for EDM, perseverance, and a little luck propelled him from beach parties to the stages of Insomniac as a field producer. This episode you won't want to miss is filled with uplifting moments and a testament to the power of following your passion. Stay tuned!

www.lasvegasedm.com

Welcome to the Las Vegas EDM Podcast. In today's episode, we're thrilled to introduce you to a rising star in the EDM scene, Antvendetta.

Antvendetta's journey into the world of music began at a remarkably young age. At just ten years old, he was already experimenting with being a DJ, thanks to the guidance of his cousin, who introduced him to the art of DJing. This early exposure ignited a passion within him that would ultimately shape his destiny.

As he grew older, Antvendetta recognized the importance of honing his skills further. He embarked on a formal education in music production, equipping himself with the technical know-how to create the very beats that would get crowds moving. However, it was only in the iconic Electric Daisy Carnival (EDC) events of 2015 and 2016 that he had a significant revelation. These moments made him reconsider his path and transform his passion into a full-fledged career.

In 2017 and 2018, Antvendetta's hard work and dedication paid off as he took center stage at the renowned Electric Zoo festival. His performances there were a testament to his musical talents and a reflection of his business acumen as he successfully managed his promotional company, setting the stage for his rise in the EDM world.

The year 2020 brought unprecedented challenges to the music industry due to the global pandemic. Antvendetta faced the harsh reality of New York's strict COVID policies, which made it exceedingly difficult to operate his promotion company and be a DJ. Moreover, he couldn't help but notice a shift in the energy of the crowds post-pandemic, with the plur (peace, love, unity, respect) ethos of the EDM community seeming somewhat diminished.

Antvendetta shares some of the most remarkable experiences from his journey as a DJ in this episode. He takes us back to the electrifying atmosphere of Minus Zero, where he performed at the same festival with legends like Illenium and Seven Lions. Additionally, he recounts the unforgettable night when he graced the stage at Roseland Ballroom in the heart of New York City, sharing the limelight with the Bingo Players.

Antvendetta leaves us with a valuable piece of advice he received from Illenium during his early days as a DJ: "Never give up." It's a mantra that has guided him through the highs and lows of his career, inspiring his music and his unwavering determination to keep the EDM spirit alive.

Join us as we delve into the world of Antvendetta, his musical journey, and the incredible moments that have defined his career. Tune in to the Las Vegas EDM Podcast and let the beats transport you to the heart of the EDM universe.

Welcome to another exciting episode of the Las Vegas EDM Podcast! A phenomenal guest joins us in this episode: Nikko, better known as Gamorex. His journey through the world of electronic music is nothing short of extraordinary.

Nikko's love affair with the turntables began at an incredibly young age, as he started DJing at the tender age of 15. Even more impressive is that he ventured into music production at just 16, showcasing his exceptional talent and passion for music.

Nikko's early DJing days were marked by spinning tracks at his family's house parties, where he honed his skills and developed an innate understanding of how to move a crowd. His natural talent and drive to explore music on a deeper level led him to Los Angeles, where he enrolled in Icon Collective to further his education in music production.

Born in Los Angeles and raised in the vibrant city of Las Vegas, Nikko's diverse background shines through in his music. With Apache heritage from his father's side and Mexican roots from his mother, his cultural influences weave a rich tapestry into his soundscape.

After completing his education, Nikko returned to his hometown of Las Vegas with a vision. He founded Digital Circus alongside his sister, a platform hosting electrifying EDM events at iconic venues such as Area15, Jackpot Bar & Grill, and First Friday. These events have become a cornerstone of the Las Vegas EDM scene, showcasing local talents.

But that's not allâ€”Nikko has a big project in the works, slated for early next year. The anticipation is building, and fans and enthusiasts eagerly await this epic event. Stay tuned for more updates!

Nikko is not just a talented artist; he's also an open-hearted collaborator who is always on the lookout for exciting partnerships and creative ventures. So, if you share his passion for music, don't hesitate to contact him. The doors of opportunity are wide open in his world.

Join us in this episode as we delve deep into Nikko's musical journey, experiences at Icon Collective, Digital Circus's founding, and upcoming monumental projects. Prepare to be inspired and entertained by the incredible musical odyssey of Gamorex. Tune in now and be part of the EDM magic!

Welcome to the latest episode of the Las Vegas EDM Podcast, where we dive into the vibrant world of electronic dance music and the incredible talents that light up the scene. In this episode, we have a special guest, Eve Hampton, also known as Princess Bubblez, who brings a unique blend of tech house and bass house vibes to the EDM spectrum.

Eve's journey through the EDM landscape is nothing short of inspiring. Originally hailing from the sunny streets of Los Angeles, California, Eve made a life-altering decision in 2018 to move to the glittering city of Las Vegas. Since then, she has been carving her path as a dynamic DJ and is currently on an exciting journey of learning music production, intending to incorporate her singing talent into her tracks.

What sets Eve apart is not just her musical prowess but also her unwavering belief in the power of unity and acceptance within the EDM community. She found her sanctuary in the EDM scene, where inclusivity is not just a word but a way of life. However, she acknowledges that there are still hurdles, mainly when representing female DJs like herself. Her experiences and insights shed light on the ongoing need for gender diversity in this industry.

A pivotal figure in Eve's journey is her friend Gamorex, the mastermind behind Digital Circus. Gamorex took Eve under his wing and taught her the art of DJing, igniting her passion for music. With a heart full of determination, Eve envisions herself DJing well into her golden years, a testament to her deep love for the craft.

Eve also shares a heartwarming story of her humble beginnings in the EDM world. She started as a first aid provider at a desert rave hosted by Planet Productions in California. Little did she know this was just the beginning of her incredible journey. Over time, her talent and dedication led her to perform at one of their events, which marked the beginning of her rise as Princess Bubblez.

Join us in this episode as we explore Eve Hampton's remarkable journey, her passion for music, her commitment to diversity, and how she evolved from a first aid provider to a prominent figure in the EDM community. Her experiences and aspirations will inspire and resonate with seasoned EDM enthusiasts and newcomers alike. So, tune in and let the beats of Princess Bubblez take you on a mesmerizing ride through the world of EDM.

Welcome to the Las Vegas EDM Podcast, where we explore the beats and creativity of the world's entertainment capital. Today, we have a unique guest, Texi Toast, a talented acrylic artist from Las Vegas who is making waves in the art scene.

Texi Toast's artistic journey began with doodles in high school classes, offering her a creative escape. Inspired by her friends' encouragement, she dedicated herself to painting, spending 5 to 16 hours on her mesmerizing creations. Her true passion lies in anime art; her talent shines through every brushstroke.

During a recent European adventure, Texi Toast immersed herself in the works of artistic legends like Van Gogh, Picasso, Michelangelo, and Da Vinci, leaving an indelible mark on her creative perspective. She draws inspiration from modern icons like Banksy and Beeple, infusing her art with contemporary flair.

But there's more to Texi Toast's journey than just art. She shares a profound connection with a flamingo spirit guide, a story filled with synchronicity that will leave you in awe. As she puts it, "Art lives beyond your life," and she's on a mission to leave her artistic legacy behind.

In this special episode, our guest cohost, Toyss, joins Texi Toast for a playful game of 'F**k, Marry, Kill,' where they tackle the ultimate question: Kakashi, Satoru Gojo, or Gabimaru? It's a fun and lively discussion that provides a unique glimpse into Texi Toast's love for anime art and her vibrant personality.

Join us on the Las Vegas EDM Podcast as we explore the intersection of art and music and discover how Texi Toast leaves its artistic mark on the city that never sleeps. Tune in for an episode filled with creativity, passion, and EDM beats!

Welcome to another electrifying episode of the Las Vegas EDM Podcast! Today, we have an extraordinary guest, Joel Cortez, who goes by the stage name Lord Izac. Hailing from the vibrant city of West Hollywood, California, Joel brings a unique and freeform DJ style that has been making waves in the EDM scene.

Joel has firmly established his presence in music with a residency at the legendary Mineshaft in Los Angeles, showcasing his incredible talent and passion for curating unforgettable musical experiences.

In this episode, get ready to be captivated by Joel's infectious personality and incredible life journey. He opens up about his experiences and aspirations, giving us a glimpse into the man behind the beats.

Joel is on an exciting trajectory and is thrilled to announce his collaboration with Hambury Mary's, which is set to redefine the party scene. His vision as a party producer is bound to leave an indelible mark on the EDM landscape.

One of the highlights of this episode is Joel's recounting of a spectacular moment in his career when he performed at a pool party in the legendary Ibiza for his birthday. The story behind his stage name, Lord Izac, is equally intriguing and is rooted in an episode of the iconic Kardashians series.

Joel's journey into DJing began with a transformative experience at EDC 2010 at the Coliseum, where Kaskade's set left an indelible imprint on his heart. This event ignited his passion for electronic music, putting him on a path that would lead him to become the celebrated DJ he is today. His dedication to his craft led him to attend the Scratch DJ Academy, where he honed his skills and refined his artistry.

Join us in this episode as we delve deep into Joel Cortez's life, his inspirations, and the incredible journey that has shaped him into the sensational DJ and party producer he is today. Tune in and prepare to be enchanted by the tales and tunes of Lord Izac, only on the Las Vegas EDM Podcast!

Welcome to the Las Vegas EDM Podcast. In this captivating episode, we have a special guest, the founder of Ascension Entertainment, Jordan Berry, known in the EDM realm as JBZL, formerly Tarxan. His transformation from hip-hop to EDM and his incredible story of resilience through addiction is nothing short of inspirational.

JBZL's name change marked a pivotal moment in his life, symbolizing a shift in his music style and a personal journey of triumph over Xanax addiction. Please tune in to hear his powerful story and the strength it took to make this transformative change.

The inception of Ascension Entertainment sprang from a disappointing desert rave experience in California. Dissatisfied with the event's quality, JBZL believed he could infuse his creativity and EDM expertise into hosting exceptional events for artists and the community. His vision materialized with the launch of their first desert festival in March 2023.

As a DJ and producer, JBZL's heart beats to the rhythms of dubstep and trap, but he considers himself a multi-faceted artist with diverse musical influences. He's performed at notable events for the Church Of Bass, Ravelation, and various events in Los Angeles, amassing a decade of experience behind the decks.

Born in Los Angeles, CA, and a resident of Las Vegas, NV, for 22 years, JBZL brings a unique blend of West Coast energy to his music and events. In this episode, you'll get to know the man behind the music and the visionary behind Asencion Entertainment.

But that's not all. Our guest host, Toyss, engages JBZL in a playful game, challenging him to decide who he'd "fuck, marry, and kill" among EDM's elite: Skrillex, Subtronics, and RL Grime. It's a lighthearted moment in an otherwise insightful conversation.

Recorded live at the iconic Jackpot Bar & Grill in Las Vegas, this episode encapsulates the essence of the EDM community and its vibrant personalities. Join us as we explore the EDM universe through JBZL's incredible journey and the electric atmosphere of the Las Vegas EDM scene. Welcome to the Las Vegas EDM Podcast, where the music never stops, and the stories are always extraordinary.

In this electrifying episode of the Las Vegas EDM Podcast, we explore the incredible journey of EDM DJ and producer Arcco. From his early start as a DJ at 9 to becoming a signed artist with Sony, Arcco's career is a testament to his musical prowess.

Arcco creates infectious beats and is the mastermind behind captivating lighting displays for global superstars like Justin Bieber, Ariana Grande, Kendrick Lamar, Bruno Mars, and Taylor Swift. He's a key player at World Wide Connection, known for its LED walls, clothing brands, and full-service entertainment offerings.

Arcco's journey wasn't without hurdles. At just 15, he faced homelessness due to meth addiction. His story turns incredible when he sneaks into Vans Warped Tour, connecting with a band that takes him on tour as their stagehand.

One of his proudest achievements is founding "Tuesday Blend," a Las Vegas event running for 13 years at 24 Oxford inside the Virgin Hotel, at the moment. Join us for an inspiring episode as Arcco shares his highs, lows, and the music that fuels his extraordinary journey. Discover the resilience and passion that have made Arcco a legend in EDM, inspiring us to chase our dreams against all odds. Tune in now and be inspired!

Welcome to the electrifying world of Black Noise, the visionary founder behind the pulsating beats of Church Of Bass. Embarking on a journey as a renegade desert events promoter, Black Noise has masterfully elevated his brainchild, Church Of Bass, from its desert roots to captivating destinations like Area15 and Daylight Beach Club at Mandalay Bay Hotel and Casino, as well as various esteemed establishments throughout Downtown Las Vegas.

This compelling episode delves into Black Noise's exhilarating trajectory, gaining insights into his upcoming ventures. Discover the ingenuity behind his ingenious mobile stage, a portable marvel that transforms any location into a vibrant festival ground within moments. Unveiling the creative mind that birthed the "Rave Or Die" billboards during the pandemic, Black Noise shares how this bold move captured the attention of a prominent venue, resulting in an invitation to showcase his dynamic events.

His journey is a testament to unwavering determination, illustrating how one can evolve from a desert renegade to a prominent figure in the illustrious Las Vegas scene. A staunch advocate for local talent, Black Noise's organic growth exemplifies the power of passion and authenticity. Tune in for an inspiring conversation that amplifies the rhythm of possibilities.

Hosted By, Christopher Tapia.
